summary: This is an email from attorney Christian Everdell to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, with copies to other attorneys, transmitting a letter regarding discovery and prison conditions for Ghislaine Maxwell. It is legal correspondence from Maxwell's defense team to the prosecution.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney at Cohen & Gresser LLP who sent the email transmitting a letter regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's case to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the attached letter regarding discovery and prison conditions, indicating she is the client being represented.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Attorney copied on the email, likely part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Attorney copied on the email, likely part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Jeff Pag
persons.context: Likely a prosecutor at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (addressed as 'USANYS'), recipient of the email.

events.title: Letter to Government re Discovery and Prison Conditions
events.description: A letter was written by Maxwell's defense team to the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding discovery issues and Maxwell's prison conditions.

keyFacts: The email transmits a letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team to the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding discovery and prison conditions.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal proceedings and concerns about Maxwell's detention conditions as of September 2020.
The defense team includes attorneys Christian Everdell, Mark S. Cohen, and Laura Menninger from Cohen & Gresser LLP.
The email is addressed to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, with Jeff Pag as a likely prosecutor recipient.
